attributes.title: Projected Number of Very High Water Flow Events -- U.S. (Russian River)
attributes.citation: L.E. Flint and A.L. Flint, 2014, California Basin Characterization Model: A Dataset of Historical and Future Hydrologic Response to Climate Change, U.S. Geological Survey Data Release, doi:10.5066/F76T0JPB
attributes.description:
Data are derived from the California Basin Characterization Model.

California Climate Commons Metadata Record 1: http://climate.calcommons.org/sites/default/files/metadata/California_Basin_Characterization_Model_BCM_downscaled_climate_and_hydrology.xml
attributes.short-description: Data show the projected frequency of 3-day "very high water flow events" on the upper and lower Russian River
attributes.subtitle: USGS California Basin Characterization Model
